data.description:
The Pebble Happiness App is a program that lets you check in on how you're feeling. You'll receive regular prompts that ask you to rate your mood and energy level. These prompts will occur either hourly or 4x per day, depending on your choice (during waking hours only!). They will also ask you where you are, who you're with, and what activities you've done recently. This information will help us provide you with deeper insights on how different environments and events impact your mood.

Due to popular demand, the program will run for the duration of your choosing: 10 days, 30 days, or indefinitely. After every 10 days, you will receive an email report with your results through a transactional email service. Pebble will not use or share your information for any purpose beyond this app (although we may use anonymous or aggregated data to improve the app and for other internal 
business purposes).

Except as described in this notice, the Pebble Privacy Policy covers the collection, use, sharing and protection of your information.  

This is not a marketing initiative or an attempt to fish for data -- its sole purpose is to be a fun, interesting experience for our users.  We hope you'll enjoy the app as much as we have!

data.description:
This is a simple application for Pebble Watch that extract all the raw Pebble Health data gathered by the watch and POST it to a user-configured HTTP endpoint.

The UI independently tracks the progress of watch-to-phone transfer (upper half) and of phone-to-webserver transfer (lower half).

Note that the use has to obtain somehow the webserver that provides the HTTP endpoint.

Data is sent with one request for each minute of Pebble Health data, and it encoded as a CSV line with the following fields:
- UTC time stamp
- number of steps
- yaw in 1/16th of turn
- pitch in 1/16th of turn
- amount of movement
- ambient light level
- activity mask

data.description:
Keep track of the score in your squash matches with simple controls and a clean, uncluttered interface. This is the squash version of
my Tennis score keeper app.

Match formats are easily configured inside the app and it defaults to the settings you last used. If your yours isn't configurable, let me know because I want to support all commonly played formats.

## Instructions

- Select the match format then choose 'Start match'
- Use the middle button to toggle who is serving first
- Your score is at the bottom and your opponent's score is at the top
- Hit the bottom button when you score, the top button when your opponent scores
- If you make a mistake, hit the middle button to undo

## Features

- Clean interface
- Service indicator
- Many match formats supported
- Infinite undo
- Post-match stats

## Roadmap

- Ability to save/resume match state with persistent storage
- Ability to view stats for previously completed matches
- Support any missing match formats

data.description:
"Fantastic Travel Currency App!" - Eric Migicovsky (Pebble CEO)
If you like my app could you please give ❤️

==New Features==
1. App Glance Mode : Total Spent Money / Today Currency Rates

2. Offline Mode : You don't need to internet!

3. Support for Spanish, French, English, Italian
and German is coming soon

TravelCrumbs helps people spend their money while traveling.

It shows the exchange rates of the current location while it keeps tracking the locations using GPS.  As you travel from country to country, all you need to do is to set your currency in your own country. And wherever you are in, TravelCrumbs will detect your location and automatically change the currency.  
In case you travel domestically TravelCrumbs will be still helpful for tracking where you have visited and checking the amount of money you spend each time.

Users can easily input via voice or button control and check the price directly. They can also see an overview of their total expenditure for the day and the places that they have visited.

TravelCrumbs is able to detect any value that you have said. We have the accurate exchange rates and location datas for over 39 countries worldwide. 

**Voice Input Guide**

e.g 102.77 USD
-> Say "one hundred two dollars and seventy seven cents" or "one hundred two point seventy seven"

==KIEZEL PAY==
Travel Crumbs is no longer free, a one time purchase using KiezelPay at $2.99 is required to continue using Travel Crumbs.

Thank you.

data.description:
PilotWatch is a watchapp dedicated to pilots doing dead reckoning navigation.
It requires no preparation. Just run the app when on board. It is the perfect companion for your navigation log.
Set the flight duration directly on the watch then start your flight.
PilotWatch records the start time.
Set the estimated leg duration on the watch directly at each turning point.
PilotWatch gives you instantly the estimated leg end time, the difference between the estimated and actual duration for the past leg.
PilotWatch will always warn you if you're approaching the end of your flight or if you've exceeded your estimated leg duration.
Finally end your flight.
PilotWatch gives you the total actual flight time, the end time and the difference between the estimate and actual flight duration.
All data is on the screen. No pages.
Colors help you identify quickly the time data.

latest_release.release_notes: v2.0 : Added support to APLITE. Improved time display. Added new graphical arcs for better reading of the most important data.

data.description:
For those who need constant reminders.
It may help with ADHD, if you're constantly distracted! OR it can remind you to do something every few mins!
 Need to remember to sprint every 5 mins in your Run? This app can help!
You can customize the time from as low as 'Remind me every 5 seconds' to 'Remind me every 60+ mins!"
It can easily be turned on/off with the 'select' button.
And you can increase an decrease the timer with the up/down buttons,
(5 sec increments) 
 
OR long press either button to increase/decrease the time by 60 seconds! 

I made this about a year ago,(first app I ever made) and finally decided to release it to the public. If it can help even ONE other person, then that would be awesome! :)
 
Now with an (optional) countdown timer display, And battery meter!

Batch Timer is an enhanced timer.
It will estimate and notify you when a batch job will finish.

Imagine that you are making a lot of copies of a document consists of several pages.
You may think you want to leave the machine and come back exactly when the copy job is done, rather than waiting in front of the machine without doing nothing. 
Batch timer will tell you when the copy finishes.

Use center button to set the duration of one copy. Push the button when one copy finishes.
Then, push again when another copy finishes. Batch timer will remember the duration.

Use up and down button to increase or decrease a number of copies.
Remaining time will be calculated and the count down start automatically.

data.description:
Check the time without having to look at your watch! Program VibrTime to one of your app launch buttons to launch it quickly. Press one of the three right hand buttons and the watch vibrates to tell you the time.

* Press the top button to vibrate the number of hours (1-12).
* Press the middle button to vibrate the number of tens of minutes (0-5).
* Press the bottom button to vibrate the number of minutes (0-9).

So if the time was 1:23pm, pressing the top button vibrates once, pressing the middle button vibrates twice and pressing the bottom button vibrates three times.

Great for meetings or if you are sight impaired.

data.author: susundberg
data.description:
Pebble application for counting and timing events! This application provides easy way to count and time different events. You can configure up to three (one for each button) items to count and time and select a good icon to indicate the task.

Currently app supports three type of actions for each button: duration, single and disabled. The duration mode allows you to measure actions with duration - like for example how long it takes to drink a beer or how long did the work travel take (with this or that route). The single mode allows you just mark events, like had a cigarette or changed baby diaper. The disabled mode is well, disabled, but it turns the screen light on, which can be handy if you measure something in night.

After you have measured you can open up a list of events on the watch (works offline without phone) and when the phone gets connected the watch synchronizes the events with the phone storage. On the watch app shows some statistics (avg interval, avg duration) on the events, but for further analysis you can get to data copy-pasted for further analysis.
data.title: Countit-all

data.description:
PomoTime - Tomato-based productivity timer

Sleek, simple, and intuitive pomodoro timer for use with Pebble. Spend less time figuring out how to use the app and more time getting things done.

Features three modes: pomodoro (25 min), short break (5 min), and long break (15 min).  Each mode allows one to pause, play, or reset timer. A vibration notification tells the user that time is up.

The pomodoro (Italian for “tomato”) technique is a productivity technique involving a 25 minute segment of concentrated work, followed by some short or long break. See http://pomodorotechnique.com/ for more details on the technique.

Tested and developed with the Pebble Time family in mind. Ever free and open source (MIT license). Developer is always welcoming comments/suggestions/patches for future versions.

Tags: pomodoro, pomodori, productivity, time management, timer

How to Export?

For First time directly open our app and export contacts For second time follow below steps.. 
1. Delete all contacts from phone book if you are exporting second time. 
2. Refresh in WhatsApp and wait till it shows 0 contacts in WhatsApp. 
3. Import new contacts in Phone book 
4. Again refresh in WhatsApp and wait until all contacts are sync. 
5. Now open our app and export all WhatsApp contacts.

data.description:
**New Feature**
With the release of 2.0 I have added the ability to specify the warmup set multipliers! This means that for each exercise you can say exactly what percentage of the max weight you want to do for each warmup set!

Warmup Sets is the watch app to have while you're in the gym! The goal is to help you determine the sets you should do for your warmup while also providing you with barbell plate math and other nifty features!

Warmup Sets automatically calculates the warmup sets for the following exercises*:
• Squat
• Bench Press
• Deadlift
• Overhead Press
• Pendlay Row
• Power Cleans

*Note: Warmup Sets is based off of the Starting Strength program.

Here's an overview of everything the Warmup Sets does:
• Calculates your warmup sets for a specific exercise
• Calculates barbell plate math for each set
• Supports both Imperial and Metric
• Allows you to specify the barbell weight
• Allows you to specify the warmup set multipliers for each exercise
• Displays the current time at the top of all of the Windows.
• Remembers settings and each exercise weight (in both unit systems)
• Timer for timing your rests in between each set (simply hit the select button from anywhere on the sets menu).

If you find any bugs, have any suggestions, or want to ask a question, feel free to contact me with the email down below!

data.description:
Built by a tennis player for tennis players. Keep track of the score in your tennis matches with simple controls and a clean, uncluttered interface.

Match formats are easily configured inside the app and it defaults to the settings you last used. If your yours isn't configurable, let me know because I want to support all commonly played formats.

## Instructions

- Select the match format then choose 'Start match'
- Use the middle button to toggle who is serving first
- Your score is at the bottom and your opponent's score is at the top
- Hit the bottom button when you score, the top button when your opponent scores
- If you make a mistake, hit the middle button to undo

## Features

- Clean interface
- Service indicator
- Many match formats supported
- Infinite undo
- Post-match stats

## Roadmap

- Ability to save/resume match state with persistent storage
- Ability to view stats for previously completed matches
- Support any missing match formats

data.description:
rcTimer is a customized timer for RC drivers using vibrator to notify driver while he/she is racing.
It has three timers:
- Pre race timer. This is the time before the race starts. Fx when race director says" 5 seconds to start!".
- Race timer. This is the main race timer.
- After race timer. This tells you how long time has elapsed since the race timer expired.
Each timer can be configured and vibration interval can also be set. Fx vibrate for each 1 min.

At some races mains are running longer that qualification, so it is possible to store up to settings in a profile. 5 profiles are available. Profiles can easily be selected from the main screen.

data.description:
Multi Time Viewer is a versatile time event viewer.

This App show remaining time/day and elapsed time/day of each time event.

You can use this app multi purpose like as
 - Daily/Weekly/Monthly routine time scheduler
 - Next Train time viewer
 - iCalendar(iCloud/Google calerndar, Outlook) event viewer
 - World time clock

Time type of event
* Periodical Time
  - Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Yearly
* Absolute Time
* Offset Time
  - offset from current UTC time

How to use
1. Create plain text Time List file.
2. Upload the Time List file to Web file server like as DropBox.
3. Open SETTING Page and input Published URL of the Time List.
4. Push Save button and Pebble load the Time List.

For more detail of Time List , Please look Samples on SETTING Page

Key Operation
* On Normal Screen
- Up/Down to scroll items
- Enter to open Menu (Title Menu on Title, General Menu on Item)
- Long push Enter to do something which assined in menu
* On Menu
- Up/Down to scroll menu
- Enter to select/change item
- Back to quit menu

Title Menu items
- Load Time List

General Menu items

changelog.release_notes:
-Support for Emery (Pebble Time 2)
-Took advantage of larger screen on Time 2 and added 4th ring.

You know, fixing bugs about sleep is hard to do when you're the one not getting sleep. So yeah, I changed the automatic averages again. I'll probably change them in the future again sometime, once I figure out a better system for what I'm doing.
Changed the way the average is calculated for total sleep minutes, the older method would return negative values and the average would be way off.
Just squashed a few bugs. Fixes the negative health percentage for users that have sleep seconds as one of their custom metric with automatic goals.
Fixed a bug where you could choose nothing for custom metrics in the config page.

Better layout for Diorite. Should be clearer and nice to look at.

Themes have been tweaked to be much clearer and less a mess.

Automatic Goals have been improved, once again. Will most likely stay the way they are for a while.

Time can not be configured to show under the Health percentage.

Each ring can be configured to contribute to the Health Percentage or not

And the biggest update, each ring be customized to show any of the available metrics in Pebble Health.
-------------------
Feel free to donate if you like the app, this helps me keep going. The donate button is found at the bottom of the configuration page.

Added support for Pebble 2 watches and OS 4.0! Once you receive your new watch you should be able to use the application.

Added App Glance that show progress. Although, it does not update in the background, I'm working on it. :P

Slightly redesigned interface with more curves. It looks prettier now.

EXPERIMENTAL: Automatic goals should be slightly improved. If they were better before, someone tell me. I'll change em' back.
Optimized automatic goals
Added the ability to shake to toggle between the different screens. Set this up in the configuration page.
Fixed a bug that caused goals not to update on the current screen, once they where changed in the settings, until you pressed either up or down on the Pebble.

Redesigned interface. It's mostly the same with a few tweaks.

Goals are now displayed under the current value for a specific metric.

Goals can now be set automatically instead of specifying them in the settings. (Check the app's configuration page on your phone)

Language options were temporarily removed from the configuration as they didn't do anything yet and could cause confusion.

-Configuration page should work better with the latest version of Clay.
-Added vibrations to let the user know configuration has been received, or the user pressed the select button and it updated the health data.

-Customizable interface colours
-Optimized colors in default theme

-View each individual metric using the Up and Down buttons on the watch.
-Force data to update by pressing Select.
-Preparation for customizable interface colours.
-Battery consumption reduced and bugs fixed.

Don't forget to leave suggestions and questions on puzzledapps.weebly.com!
Fixed a bug where the sleep ring would not show up until you saved in the configuration page.

http://puzzledapps.weebly.com/activity.html
is the new website page for Activity.

Health percentage now waits until each ring has made a full circle at least once before going over 100%.

Each ring can only contribute to 1/3 of the Health percentage unless each ring has done at least one full circle.

Once you go over your goal and fill the ring, a darker ring will appear under while a new one starts.

Each goal is now customizable through the configuration page on the phone. (Works offline unlike most other config pages).
Changed active calorie goal to 500.

Initial release

Shows your active calories, active minutes and sleep minutes with a total completion percentage called "Health"

Customization coming soon.

data.description:
Display your activity (and sleep) and receive a "Health" percentage.

The "Health" percentage gives you a completion percentage of all three rings combined.
--------------------
The red ring, shows you your active calories burned. (Default goal of 300 active calories)

The green ring, shows you your active minutes. (Default goal of 60 minutes or 1 hour)

The blue ring, shows you your sleep minutes. (Default goal of 480 minutes or 8 hours)
--------------------
Each goal is customizable with rings that go darker when goal is met.

data.description:
The GPS Tracker app is a powerful wrist map, and can also be used to track your pals.

The top button activates the backlight, and the bottom button pans the map depending on the tilt of the watch. The middle (select) button activates the menu wheel.

The menu wheel has options for updating your location, zooming in (+) and out (-), panning, markers (X), and custom settings.

To drop a marker, pan the map and choose "Add New Marker" from the markers menu. You can customize the marker label in the Settings page. The last choice in the markers menu is GeoLocation for displaying the street address.

If you give yourself a NAME and specify a GROUP in the Settings screen through the Pebble Time phone app, then your location will be shared with others in the same GROUP. Use the group name "public" to see others that want to be seen. The “Wakeup” feature can be used to periodically send your GPS to your pals, even if the GPS Tracker is not active.

The settings menu contains many options, including map service, process image, date format, and more. For the process image settings, you can choose to dither and/or boost the contrast of the mapping tiles for better readability. Location refresh is how often the GPS on the smart phone is queried.

Mapping tiles Copyright and courtesy of OpenStreetMap, OpenStreetMap contributors, DigitalGlobe, Google Maps, ESRI ArcGIS, Bing maps, Stamen, and NOAA. Stamen data by Stamen Design (http://stamen.com); OpenStreetMap (http://openstreetmap.org) mapping tiles under Creative Commons licenses.

changelog.release_notes:
Removed code that set location to always be somewhere in the UK, instead of where the GPS says you are!

Also changed menu icon for Pebble OS 4

Worked around firmware bug in v4 firmware that caused watch to crash/reboot intermittently when compass was used.

Thanks to Peter Summers for finding the workaround (https://forums.pebble.com/t/compass-functionality-unstable-in-pebble-os-4-0-fixed-sort-of-i-think/23541/15)
Option to filter found caches also now filters caches hidden by the user.
Fixed bug where memory would run out and app would exit on original pebbles

1. Now uses Geocaching Live API. This means that you will need to re-authenticate in the settings, and basic members will only be able to get locations of traditional caches.
2. Renamed from "Geocaching" to "Watch Caching" because "Geocaching" as an app name is trademarked by Groundspeak.
3. Now uses corrected coordinates. If a user has entered corrected coordinates for a geocache, they will be used. (This only applies to Premium members because you can't have corrected coordinates on a traditional geocache)
4. Date is displayed in status bar. You no longer have to exit the app to see the date so you can write it down in logs!
Fixed crash when parsing geocaches (including on startup) on monochrome watches

- Now working for Android 5+ users!
- Now shows arrow instead of tuning message when compass is still tuning because some users reported it never finishing tuning.
Fixed an issue where users weren't able to log in if language was not set to English on geocaching website
First release

data.description:
Watch Caching enables you to navigate to nearby geocaches using only your pebble smartwatch.

It will retrieve a list of up to 50 nearby geocaches from geocaching.com and, using the compass in the watch and the GPS in your phone, will show you the distance and direction so that you can find the geocache without ever taking your phone out of your pocket.

Because of Geocaching Live API limitiations, basic members will only be able to get details of traditional geocaches.

data.description:
Tracking and maintaining a consistent caloric intake is one of the most effective ways to control your weight and consequently, your overall health.  Inspired in part by SaltyBrains' Calorie Timer, Advanced Calorie Counter tracks Calories (kcals) over time and counts down to when you burn off Calories you've consumed.  It also keeps track of your caloric intake each day.  Each press of the UP button adds 50 calories to the timer (if you add too many, you can adjust with the DOWN button).

- Custom daily Calorie goal sets rate of calorie burn (default is 1800)
- Automatic reset of daily Calories (defaults to 5 a.m. to accommodate late night snacks, but changeable in settings)
- Countdown to burning off all consumed Calories
- Support for all pebble models.
- Custom daily calorie goal sets rate of calorie burn
